text: Which of the following phenomena is the practical evidence for the existence of the continual motion of molecules?

options.A: the chemical balance operates on the principle of moments
options.B: the sprin balance operates on Hooke's law
options.C: either may be used to measure the weight of a substance

The frequency of a swinging pendulum is the

options.A: number of complete oscillations the pendulum makes in a second
options.B: number of amplitudes the bob makes in a second
options.C: angle the bob swings through in a second
options.D: distance the bob covers in a second

text: Which of the following about an object performing simple harmonic motion is correct? Its acceleration

options.A: is maximum at the extreme ends
options.B: is constant and directed towards a fixed point
options.C: is zero when it is displayed from the equilibrum position
options.D: varies linearly with the displacement from a fixed point and is directed towards the fixed point

explanation: In simple harmonic motion (SHM), the acceleration is maximum at the extreme points (maximum displacement) of the motion. These points are where the restoring force is strongest, leading to the highest acceleration. Therefore, the correct answer is 'is maximum at the extreme ends. although option D is also true.

text: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.C: the real expansivity of a liquid is less than its apparent expansivity

text: The pressure exerted by a given mass of gas in a container

options.A: decreases if the container is heated
options.B: increases if the molecules of the gas move faster
options.C: increases if the container is doubled
options.D: decreases as the kinetic energy of the gas molecules inceases

text: Which of the following statements about a progressive mechanical wave is correct?

options.B: its energy is localised at specific points of its profile
options.C: it does not require a material medium for its propagation
options.D: its frequency remains constant as it travels between different media

text: The distance between two points in phase on a progressive wave is 5cm. If the sped of the wave is 0.2ms-1, calculate its period

options.A: distance travelled by the wave in a complete cycle of its motion
options.B: maximum diplacement of the wave particle from the equilibrum position

options.D: distance between two successive troughs of the wave

text: Which of the following optical instruments does not depend on the use of plane mirrors?

The ability of a material to store an electric charge when its plates are at different potentials is referred to as its
Two capacitors if capacitance 0.4\(\mu F\) and 0.5\(\mu F\) are connected in parallel and charged to a p.d. of 50V, Determine the total charge acquired

A parallel plate capacitor of capacitance 600\(\mu F\) has a potential difference of 200V between its plates. Calculate the charge on either plate of the capacitor
a chemical cell of internal resistance 1\(\Omega\) supplies electric current to an external resistor of resistance 3\(\Omega\). Calculate the efficiency of the cell
An electric lamp is rated 240V, 40W. What is the cost of running the lamp for 72 hours if the electricity authority charges N2.50 per kWh?
Which of the following statements explains lost volt in an electric circuit? The

options.A: total p.d from a source to maintain a flow of current through the circuit as well as the source
options.B: p.d to drive current through the circuit component except the source
options.C: p.d across all external components connected to the source of electricity
options.D: p.d across the internal resistance of the cell

explanation: The lostvolt is the potential drop in a cell due to internal resistance.

text: A constantan wire has a cross sectional area of 4 x 10-8m2 and a resistivity of 1.1 x 10-6\(\Omega\)m. If a resistor of resistance 11\(\Omega\) is to be made from this wire, calculate the length of the wire required

Lenz's law of electromagnetic induction states that

options.A: a force is exerted on a current-carrying conductor in a magnetic field
options.B: electromotive force id induced in a circuit whenever there is a change in the magnetic flux linked with the circuit
options.C: the magnitude of the induced electromotive force in a circuit is proportional to the rate of change of flux linking the circuit
options.D: the induced current in a coil is in such a direction that it sets up a magnetic field which opposes the change producing it

text: A bar magnet is placed near and lying along the axis of a solenoid connected to a galvanometer. The pointer of the galvanometer shows no deflection when

options.A: the magnet is moved away from the stationary solenoid
options.B: the solenoid is moved away from the stationary magnet
options.C: the magnet is moved towards the stationary solenoid
options.D: there is no relative motion between the magnet and the solenoid
